intro: Anadenia pulchella, commonly known as the red belladonna lily, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking red flowers with yellow markings. The plant produces a bulbous root system and has lance-shaped, dark green leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its toxicity, it should be handled with care.
